Beeville Police Department
February 16, 2018 at 10:55 AM ¬∑

PRESS RELEASE:

On February 15, 2018 at approximately 11:00pm, reports were made to Beeville Police about a possible threat to Beeville Independent School District, A. C. Jones High School. Police received images of social media posts indicating that an incident may occur.
Investigators were immediately assigned to the complaint and a team of officers worked through the night gathering information. Investigators conducted interviews with identified individuals as early as 4:00am on February 16, 2018.
After intensive investigation, the threat was determined to be not credible. As a precautionary measure, Beeville ISD and Beeville Police Department implemented a plan for extra police presence at all ISD campuses, which was expanded to cover all schools within city limits, including non ISD schools.
The Beeville Police Department wants to reassure parents that it is safe for children to attend school today.

WATER BOIL NOTICE FOR BEEVILLE!!

As of 6:00pm, the City of Beeville has issued a water boil notice to all customers who get their water from the city water system. The boil notice is due to a low Chlorine level found during routine testing. Water may be used for bathing but any use for cleaning or food preparation must be boiled and then cooked before use.

It is recommended that water be brought to a rolling boil for at least 2 minutes and then cooled in order to be used for cooking or cleaning. This includes brushing teeth or washing face.

The Chlorine levels will continue to be tested regularly until the levels reach TCEQ standards.
